metadata.feature_description: Calculate and display user engagement and influence percentages (Social SKU only)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display engagement percentage with progress bar

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Users and click on User Activity icon for Test User12
steps.expected: User Activity panel expands showing engagement metrics
steps.actual: User Activity panel expanded showing ENGAGEMENT section with progress bar and value of 0

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display influence percentage with progress bar

steps.action: View User Activity panel for Test User12
steps.expected: Influence percentage displayed with progress bar (0-100%)
steps.actual: INFLUENCE section displayed with progress bar showing value of 2 (indicating 2% influence)

steps.action: View User Activity for Test User01
steps.actual: Test User01 showed INFLUENCE value of 1, demonstrating different influence levels between users

steps.action: View User Activity for Test User11 who has no engagement
steps.expected: Engagement shows 0% with empty progress bar
steps.actual: ENGAGEMENT displayed as 0 with empty progress bar, correctly showing zero engagement

steps.action: View User Activity for Test User10
steps.expected: Engagement shows 0% with empty progress bar
steps.actual: ENGAGEMENT displayed as 0 and INFLUENCE displayed as 0, both with empty progress bars

steps.action: View User Activity for multiple users without engagement data
steps.expected: System should handle missing data without errors, displaying 0
steps.actual: All users with no engagement data correctly displayed 0 values without any errors or broken UI elements

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify metrics only show for Social SKU

steps.action: Verify that engagement and influence metrics are visible in the UI
steps.expected: Metrics should be visible because site is running Evoq Engage (Social SKU)
steps.actual: ENGAGEMENT and INFLUENCE sections are visible in the User Activity panel. The trial banner confirms 'Evoq Engage' SKU which includes Social features.

steps.action: Click Edit Points link to modify user points
steps.expected: Edit dialog opens allowing modification of Reputation and Experience
steps.actual: Edit Points dialog opened with editable fields for REPUTATION and EXPERIENCE, plus a Notes field. ENGAGEMENT and INFLUENCE values are calculated and not directly editable.

observations: Engagement and Influence values are calculated metrics that cannot be directly edited - they are derived from user activities tracked by the analytics system
The progress bars scale from 0-100% with the numeric value displayed alongside
Test User12 had the highest influence value (2) among tested users, while most users showed 0 engagement and 0-1 influence
The SuperUser Account (host) row does not display User Activity icon - this appears to be intentional behavior for the super user
Code review confirms engagement is calculated from XML time series data via GetUserEngagement method using yearly intervals compared to OptimalEngagementScore
Influence is calculated from Analytics_UserInfluenceRollup table with daily/weekly/monthly/yearly breakdowns
